channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: People Are Paying to Get Their Chatbots High on ‘Drugs’
item.description: An online marketplace is selling code modules that simulate the effects of cannabis, ketamine, cocaine, ayahuasca, and alcohol when they are uploaded ...

item.title: Mozilla’s new CEO says AI is coming to Firefox, but will remain a choice
item.description: Mozilla has appointed Anthony Enzor-DeMeo as its CEO, as the Firefox developer scrambles to adapt in a rapidly changing browser market.

item.title: Apple Engineers Are Inspecting Bacon Packaging to Help Level Up US Manufacturers
item.description: Initial participants in the new Apple Manufacturing Academy tell WIRED that the tech giant’s surprising frankness and hands-on support are already ben...

item.title: How to Watch the Final Meteor Shower of 2025
item.description: Conditions in the US should be perfect for the final meteor shower of 2025, with no moonlight present to interfere with spotting shooting stars.

item.title: Google launches Gemini 3 Flash, makes it the default model in the Gemini app
item.description: Google is making Gemini 3 Flash the default model in the Gemini app and oAI model for Search

item.title: Coursera and Udemy enter a merger agreement valued at around $2.5B
item.description: Coursera and Udemy, two of the biggest names in online learning, are combining platforms next year.

item.title: 17 Best Stocking Stuffers (2025): Unique and Unconventional
item.description: Start off on the right foot (and buy the grown-ups some time to make coffee) with these excellent, tiny gifts.

item.title: Warner Bros. Discovery rejects Paramount’s hostile bid, calls offer ‘illusory’
item.description: Warner Bros. Discovery called Paramount's offer "illusory" and said that the company had misled shareholders about its financing.

item.title: 15 Best Food Gifts, as Tested by Our Tastebuds (2025)
item.description: From tinned fish to baked goodies, you can deliver the best-tasting treats to their door—even if you don’t live close by.

item.title: Bluesky launches a privacy-focused ‘find friends’ feature without invite spam
item.description: The Bluesky contact matching feature is opt-in and your data won't be used to spam your friends, the social network says.
